citation.article-title: Sporomusa, a new genus of Gram-negative anaerobic bacteria including Sporomusa sphaeroides spec. nov. and Sporomusa ovata spec. nov.

p.s: Sporomusa (Spo.ro.mu'sa. L. n. sporus a spore, M.L.n. musa a banana; M.L.f.n. Sporomusa meaning spore bearing banana)
Gram-negative by staining and cell wall profile.
Certain N-methyl compounds, amino acids, alcohols, diol compounds, hydroxy fatty acids and pyruvate or glycerol may be utilized.
Sugars are not the preferred substrate.
Chemolithotrophic using hydrogen plus carbon dioxide as growth substrate.
Acetate is the major fermentation product.
Butyrate, propionate, succinate or lactate are not formed.
Cytochromes (b; possibly c) and ubiquinones present.
G+C content of the DNA ranges from 41.3 - 47.4 mol% (thermal melting).
